displaytitle: Relief: Akhenaten and two daughters (head of Princess a modern addition)
creditline: Museum purchase, John Maclean Magie, Class of 1892, and Gertrude Magie Fund

titles.title: Relief: Akhenaten and two daughters (head of Princess a modern addition)

texts.textentryhtml: With Mathias Komor; purchased by Gilbert Denman in 1970; then apparently returned to M. Komor; subsequently purchased by Peter Scharrer; purchased by the Museum from Peter Sharrer in 1972.

bibliography.boilertext: Robert Cohon, Discovery and deceit: archaeology & the forger's craft, (Kansas City, MO: Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, 1996).
bibliography.citation: Robert Cohon, Discovery and deceit: archaeology & the forger's craft, (Kansas City, MO: Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, 1996).

Gunther Roeder, Amarna-Reliefs aus Hermopolis (Hildesheim: Gerstenberg, 1969)., p. 406, cat. no. PC71; pl. 217. The fragment is mentioned on: p. 155, V-D-6: Group originally = two daughters between king and queen. 172, V-M-4a: Two cartouches on arm of older princess (probably Merit-Aten); one on lower arm of Nefertiti. 182, V-N- 18d: Two daughters, probably Merit-Aton and Anches-en-pa-Aton. 232, V-T-6a: Bouquet in hands of smaller princess. 273, VI-D-3: Unusual composition; undoubtedly four figures; younger daughter (name erased) turns from king toward odler sister; latter undoubtedly Merit-Aton, since cartouche of Nefertiti is on her arm. 278, VI-H-7d: Cartouches of Nefertiti and a co-regent. Frames insufficiently preserved for dating. 283, VI-B-2: Younger daughter shown in grotesque manner of early part of period. 285, VI-M-11e: Cartouche of Nefertiti and three others (barely legible) on arm of a daughter, probably Merit-Aton. 287, VI-N-1g: Name of Merit-Aton perhaps to be supplied by grown daughter. 294, VI-N-7f: Merit-Aton, Anches-en-pa-Aton. 324, VI-T-6: Tightly bound bouquet; offering. 370, VII-C-3h: Discussion of groups. 372, VII-C-4b: Grotesque style; difference in size of daughters makes it likely that they are Merit-Amon and Anches-en-pa-Aton, so date perhaps after death of Makit-Aton (ca. 12th year of reign). 406, cat. no. 71: Listed among pieces in private collections; above reference given.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions 1972", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 32, no. 1 (1973): p. 20-30.
bibliography.citation:
"Acquisitions 1972", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 32, no. 1 (1973): p. 20-30.

, p. 30

bibliography.boilertext: "[Chronique des arts et de la curiosité: supplément à la Gazette des beaux-arts, no. 1249 (Feb., 1973)]", Chronique des arts et de la curiosité: supplément à la Gazette des beaux-arts, no. 1249 (Feb., 1973).
